intro: Adenocalymma magnoalatum, commonly known as the large-flowered adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a subject of interest in botanical studies.
